_meta.description: Tier 2 fate choice templates for dramatic decision points
_meta.usage: Reference for fate-choice.ts when generating dramatic choices
design_principles: NPC path is survival but loss of player control
Roll path keeps control but risks death/fall
Third path offers a different trade-off

dark_bargain.description: A powerful entity offers safety at the cost of service

accept.description: Accept the bargain. Survive, but serve.
consequences: Character becomes NPC in antagonist's service
May appear as ally, enemy, or neutral figure later
Player loses control but character persists
Roll death/fall check at current odds
If failed: death or major fall

counter.description: Make a counter-offer. Change the terms.
consequences: Fate pressure temporarily reduced but will return

examples: The Queen of Shadows offers sanctuary—serve her, lose yourself
The demon whispers: your soul for your survival
The emperor grants pardon in exchange for eternal loyalty

betrayal_escape.description: Survival requires betraying allies or principles

consequences: May face later consequences from betrayed allies

stand.description: Stand with them. Face the odds together.
consequences: If failed: death with honor or capture

sacrifice.description: Sacrifice yourself so they can escape.
consequences: Allies escape and may rescue later
Heroic reputation, but no longer playable

examples: Give up their location or die with them
Testify against your mentor or share their fate
Abandon the refugees or be overrun defending them

corruption_temptation.description: Power or victory available at moral cost

embrace.description: Accept the power. Become something else.
consequences: May become future threat to other PCs
Roll fall check (not death unless in danger)

bargain.description: Take only what you need. Stay in control.

examples: Drink the blood of the demon to gain its strength
Accept the dark artifact that whispers promises
Use the forbidden ritual to save your people

succession_crisis.description: Position can be kept only by unacceptable means

abdicate.description: Step down. Let someone else bear the burden.
consequences: May guide successor but no longer in control

fight.description: Fight for your position. Winner takes all.
consequences: If survived: position secured, enemies made
Fate pressure reduced but vulnerabilities remain

examples: Your council demands you name an heir or be removed
The pretender has equal claim—share the throne or duel
Your people have lost faith—retire or be overthrown

final_stand.description: No escape, only how the end comes

consequences: May be rescued or ransomed later

fight.description: Fight to the last. Die on your feet.
consequences: Roll death check at high odds
If survived: legendary reputation, narrow escape

escape.description: Find a way out. Leave everything behind.

examples: The castle is breached, enemies at the door
Your ship is sinking, enemy fleet surrounds you
Assassins have you cornered in the alley

prophetic_doom.description: Fate itself seems to demand the character's end

accept.description: Accept your fate. Fulfill the prophecy.
consequences: Character fulfills destiny, leaves player control
May become legend, god, or something else

defy.description: Defy destiny. The prophecy was wrong.
consequences: If survived: broke the chains of fate
If failed: prophecy fulfilled despite defiance

redirect.description: Fulfill the letter but not the spirit.
consequences: Neither victory nor defeat, but change

examples: The oracle said you would die this day
The curse reaches its final hour
The god you serve demands your sacrifice

npc_transition.description: Character leaves player control but persists in world

fate_roll.description: Roll against fate pressure for death/fall

complication.description: Delay fate but create new problems

transformed_fate.description: Change the terms but not escape

personalization_hooks.use_vulnerabilities: Match choice pattern to entity's specific weaknesses
personalization_hooks.use_relationships: Involve NPCs the character has bonds with
personalization_hooks.use_antagonists: If known antagonist exists, cast them as tempter/threat
personalization_hooks.use_values: Challenge what the character believes in
personalization_hooks.use_history: Reference past events and exposure log entries
